result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Aaron Todd Buggs.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Stephanie Krueger for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Due to communication breakdown, defendant requested that counsel withdraw. Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court. Court adjourns matter for a status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Branch 11. Status Conference is scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 1:30pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for the Defendant, received and filed.
Forwarded for signature.

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Aaron Todd Buggs.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Stephanie Krueger. 

Defense filed a Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail.  Bail motion by Defense argued and denied by the Court.  Scheduling conference remains calendared on September 27, 2022 at 1:30 PM in Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron Todd Buggs appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron Todd Buggs appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
